name: aloft Birmingham Soho Square

reviews.text: Nice Hotel in Cute area with nice little shops around it... Typical Aloft... not in downtown but I prefer this part of Birmingham. Bliss products in the bathroom... small fridge... very clean and I slept well. Indoor free parking.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Cute area with nice little shops

reviews.text: We stayed at Aloft for a family event over the Thanksgiving weekend. We had four generations staying in 3 rooms. Each room was modern and very clean and well appointed. The management fulfilled my request to have all the rooms on the same floor -- actually right next to each other.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: We enjoyed the lobby area especially the pool table. Ample parking, but the hotel was not full so that could be a problem during a busy time.
reviews.title: Tries to be cute and tongue-in-cheek, but fails

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at ALOFT in Birmingham for a wedding back in May, sharing a room with my friend and fellow bridesmaid. Since I'm not from Birmingham and was going to specific events associated with the wedding, I can't comment too much on the location, but I will say that it was in walking distance of a drug store, a grocery store, a place to grab lunch, etc. which was nice.
reviews.title: Excellent location for a stay in Birmingham

reviews.text: The interior of the hotel is very trendy, as people have noted, but in a cheap, Ikea-looking kind of way. The lobby is sort of industrial, with the reception desk in a circular console. There's a breakfast area over to the side where you can purchase coffee, bagels, etc. in the mornings (their website, I thought, made it sound like these things were complimentary, but they're not).
reviews.title: My go-to in Birmingham

reviews.text: I was prepared to like aloft in Birmingham. The lobby is hip and the front desk staff friendly and helpful. The room is modern -- I liked the layout, the comfy bed, free bottled water, single serve coffee/tea machine with to go cups and the shower. I was even willing to overlook the big brown stains on the carpet by the door. However, when the people in the next room started talking and I could hear every word, that's when I decided I didn't like aloft so much. I immediately went to the HVAC unit, were there was a button called "continuous fan," which sounded like the answers to the noise problem. However, it didn't work.
reviews.title: Paper thin walls make this hotel a loser

reviews.text: I got in late and had to get up early. Call me kooky, but I expect to be able to sleep in a hotel, especially on a Sunday night. I know aloft is suppose to be a cheaper version of W hotels, but really, there is no excuse for hearing everything in neighboring rooms. I won't be staying in aloft hotels again.
reviews.title: Very trendy, seems out of place in Birmingham

reviews.text: I really liked this hotel; visiting Birmingham for an overnight business trip. My room overlooked the Homewood Police Department (not too scenic), but there was very little outside noise. I liked the bathroom, but I was by myself so I didn't have a concern about lack of privacy. An iron and ironing board would have been nice and the closet was basically a short slanted bar with room for only a few hanging items. Since I was only there overnight, that also was not a big concern. I had a room on the top floor and was very far from the elevator so it was quiet. I do concur with some of the other reviews about the air conditioner. For such a new hotel, the AC was very loud and very difficult to maintain a comfortable temperature in the room.
reviews.title: Full disclosure: Writing this from my room at 2 a.m. after laying awake for the 2nd straight night BECAUSE IT IS SO LOUD HERE!!

reviews.text: I also thought the breakfast was overpriced. I grabbed a muffin before I realized that it was $3.50--a little expensive for hotel lobby food. Check-in was quick and at check-out the guy at the front desk was very nice.
reviews.title: Swanky, but not practical for a business trip!

reviews.text: I asked for dinner recommendations at check-in. They recommended the restaurant attached in the hotel. It was listed as steak and seafood. I walked in and it smelled like a short-order diner. I walked out and tried Lovoy's across the street. It was a quick walk, but I wouldn't recommend it. It was mediocre Italian--I will drive somewhere in the future.
reviews.title: Good for a quick stay

reviews.text: Have stayed here several times. Never had any problems.
reviews.title: Stay here often

reviews.text: The minute you walk in - you see its trendy atmosphere. Perhaps its just my taste to have a more traditional hotel, but the seating the lobby is more modular and less comfy for visiting with friends and family. The rooms are clean and "neat" looking... definitely a different layout, but spacious. The desk staff while trying to be helpful, weren't very knowledgeable when asking for recommendations regarding the surrounding area. Just not my cup of tea.
reviews.title: Trendy, but lacking service, comfort

reviews.text: I actually stayed in this hotel off and on for a grand total of 9 weeks from January 2011 to May 2011 for business. I loved that there are various dining options within very close walking distance from the hotel. I liked that the hotel bar was open until midnight. I liked that the hotel caters to the "tech savvy" in that each room has an ipod hookup that allows you to listen to your ipod via the TV (not to mention wi-fi in the lobby, ipod hookups on the workout equipment, etc). The rooms were clean, sleek and had a small "dorm fridge" which was awesome for keeping waters and snacks in the room. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel staff is amazing - they took time to learn my name during my stay and always greeted each guest with a smile. I even returned a month later to the area for a personal trip and we stayed at this hotel. If you are looking for a young, hip hotel vibe this is your place!!
reviews.title: Great stay for business & fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not a fan of drop of the moment trips because they typically involve me rushing to find someone to watch my dog. My boyfriend and I recently decided just such a trip was necesary a few weeks ago.....this time however we seemed to strike oil when we found the aloft in Birmingham.
reviews.title: Amazing, contemporary and pet friendly!

reviews.text: This hotel offers the contemporary, clean setting we crave when we travel as well as an outstanding pet policy. All pets are welcomed with a treats, bowls and a few toys. It was incredible!! Typically you can't take even take a pet with you on your trips and here they went above and beyond to make us and our furry family friend comfortable and welcomed.
reviews.title: I had a tremendous time at the Aloft Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed here about 7 or 8 times over the past year. The beds and rooms are clean and extremely comfortable. The staff are awesome and extremely friendly. The all day cafe is great as the area does tend to close down around 9.00pm.
reviews.title: Always good and a great price

reviews.text: I have stayed in several different hotels around Birmingham for work. This was by far my favorite. It was newer, sleeker, trendier (but not too trendy), and at a good price. The staff was super friendly and I enjoyed the lobby atmosphere. Will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Super pet-friendly hotel located close to Standifer Animal Clinic, where Biscuit spent the day getting groomed while Mom and Dad spent the day shopping scenic downtown-Homewood. Mom and Dad also enjoyed the pool at the end of our busy day and sacked out on the ultra-soft bed linens. Bliss bath products are always a plus. We will be back soon.
reviews.title: My Dog Biscuit Loves Aloft

reviews.text: First time at an Aloft and I really dig the digs!
reviews.title: Really enjoyed the stay here..........
Said they were a Sister Hotel of the "W" in New York....
reviews.text: Love the design and look they are going with here. Entire staff very helpful, lobby clean wide open and ultra chic.

aka: Aloft Birmingham Soho Square Hotel Homewood
description: Aloft Birmingham Soho Square is a hip new hotel! Enjoy the chic amenities of Soho Square. Walk to great shopping and local restaurants.
